name: Switch
description: The Switch component (toggle) is a digital on/off switch.

props.name: checked
props.doc: Determine whether the switch is checked or not. The default will be `false`.

props.name: title
props.doc: The `title` of the input - describing it a bit further for accessibility reasons.

props.name: label
props.doc: Use either the `label` property or provide a custom one.

props.name: labelPosition
props.doc: Defines the position of the `label`. Use either `left` or `right`. Defaults to `right`.

props.name: labelSrOnly
props.doc: Use `true` to make the label only readable by screen readers.

props.name: size
props.doc: The size of the switch. For now there is **medium** (default) and **large**.

props.name: status
props.doc: Text with a status message. The style defaults to an error message. You can use `true` to only get the status color, without a message.

props.name: statusState
props.doc: Defines the state of the status. Defaults to `error`.

props.name: statusProps
props.doc: Use an object to define additional [FormStatus](/uilib/components/form-status/properties/) properties.

props.name: suffix
props.doc: Text describing the content of the Switch more than the label. You can also send in a React component, so it gets wrapped inside the Switch component.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: innerRef
props.doc: By providing a React.ref we can get the internally used input element (DOM). E.g. `innerRef={myRef}` by using `React.createRef()` or `React.useRef()`.

events.name: onChange
events.doc: Will be called on state changes made by the user.

events.name: onChangeEnd
events.doc: Will be called on state changes made by the user, but with a delay. This way the user sees the animation before e.g. an error will be removed. Returns a boolean { checked, event }.

events.name: onClick
events.type: ({ checked: boolean; event: MouseEvent, preventDefault: () => void }) => void
